title: Vase, 1984-84-2, 1912
markings: Impressed on bottom, underglaze:  RP cipher with 14 flames, XII beneath, 2000/ V. Impressed artist's monogram, conjoined within circlue: CS; incised V.
creditline: Gift of Marcia and William Goodman
description: White clay body, cast.  Wide flaring cylindrical body with truncated rim; no foot.  Underglaze slip-decorated around body with landscape scene of lake, low hills and trees in background.  On front is a cluster of birch trees in foreground.  Colors range from blues to grays, with accents of browns in the trees.  Allover clear high glaze; fine crazing.  Interior and bottom glazed.

exhibitions.title: New Vistas:  American Art Pottery from The Cooper-Hewitt Museum
